metadata.title: CVE-2022-3545 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability has been found in Linux Kernel and classified as critical.Affected by this vulnerability is the function area_cache_get of the filedrivers/net/ethernet/netronome/nfp/nfpcore/nfp_cppcore.c of the componentIPsec. The manipulation leads to use after free. It is recommended to applya patch to fix this issue. The identifier VDB-211045 was assigned to thisvulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3545` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.1.0-14.14
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 6.1.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.1.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 6.1.0-14.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 6.2.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 6.2.0-1004.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1004.5
No subscription required
